alert.note: Alert for Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 9:47PM AKST until January 16 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT CONTINUES IN THE THE NEW WORK WEEK... .The three day system appears to be on its last legs with the northerly frontal boundary beginning to pick up speeds as it moves southward. Yakutat has had nearly all of its moisture and lift move southward with Haines and Skagway to follow next. The bulk of the moisture appears to be around the central panhandle and Juneau, with rates around half an inch per hour and PW around 150% of normal. Similar rates can be found around Haines and Skagway, however, this is due to enhanced lift from a boundary between two air masses. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Prince of Wales Island and Ketchikan Gateway Borough. * WHEN...Until 3 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall accumulations expected between 9 pm and Midnight.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

area.areaDesc: Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Prince of Wales Island
